channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache Traffic Server
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache Traffic Server

item.title: CVE-2021-44040|2024-08-04T04:10:17.217Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description: Improper Input Validation vulnerability in request line parsing of Apache Traffic Server allows an attacker to send invalid requests. This issue affects Apache Traffic Server 8.0.0 to 8.1.3 and 9.0.0 to 9.1.1.

item.title: CVE-2021-37149|2024-08-04T01:16:03.937Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description: Improper Input Validation vulnerability in header parsing of Apache Traffic Server allows an attacker to smuggle requests. This issue affects Apache Traffic Server 8.0.0 to 8.1.2 and 9.0.0 to 9.1.0.

item.title: CVE-2021-41585|2024-08-04T03:15:28.820Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description: Improper Input Validation vulnerability in accepting socket connections in Apache Traffic Server allows an attacker to make the server stop accepting new connections. This issue affects Apache Traffic Server 5.0.0 to 9.1.0.

item.title: CVE-2021-37148|2024-08-04T01:16:03.219Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description: Improper input validation vulnerability in header parsing of Apache Traffic Server allows an attacker to smuggle requests. This issue affects Apache Traffic Server 8.0.0 to 8.1.2 and 9.0.0 to 9.0.1.

item.title: CVE-2020-9494|2024-08-04T10:34:37.925Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description: Apache Traffic Server 6.0.0 to 6.2.3, 7.0.0 to 7.1.10, and 8.0.0 to 8.0.7 is vulnerable to certain types of HTTP/2 HEADERS frames that can cause the server to allocate a large amount of memory and spin the thread.

item.title: CVE-2021-37150|2024-08-04T01:16:04.051Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description: Improper Input Validation vulnerability in header parsing of Apache Traffic Server allows an attacker to request secure resources. This issue affects Apache Traffic Server 8.0.0 to 9.1.2.

item.title: CVE-2021-44759|2024-08-04T04:32:12.307Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description: Improper Authentication vulnerability in TLS origin validation of Apache Traffic Server allows an attacker to create a man in the middle attack. This issue affects Apache Traffic Server 8.0.0 to 8.1.0.

item.title: CVE-2021-38161|2024-08-04T01:37:15.519Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description: Improper Authentication vulnerability in TLS origin verification of Apache Traffic Server allows for man in the middle attacks. This issue affects Apache Traffic Server 8.0.0 to 8.0.8.

item.title: CVE-2021-35474|2024-08-04T00:40:46.453Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description: Stack-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability in cachekey plugin of Apache Traffic Server. This issue affects Apache Traffic Server 7.0.0 to 7.1.12, 8.0.0 to 8.1.1, 9.0.0 to 9.0.1.

item.title: CVE-2021-37147|2024-08-04T01:16:02.883Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description: Improper input validation vulnerability in header parsing of Apache Traffic Server allows an attacker to smuggle requests. This issue affects Apache Traffic Server 8.0.0 to 8.1.2 and 9.0.0 to 9.1.0.

item.title: CVE-2021-43082|2024-08-04T03:47:13.379Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow') vulnerability in the stats-over-http plugin of Apache Traffic Server allows an attacker to overwrite memory. This issue affects Apache Traffic Server 9.1.0.

item.title: CVE-2023-38522|2024-08-02T17:46:55.187Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description:
Apache Traffic Server accepts characters that are not allowed for HTTP field names and forwards malformed requests to origin servers. This can be utilized for request smuggling and may also lead cache poisoning if the origin servers are vulnerable.
This issue affects Apache Traffic Server: from 8.0.0 through 8.1.10, from 9.0.0 through 9.2.4.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 8.1.11 or 9.2.5, which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-35296|2024-08-02T03:07:46.831Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description:
Invalid Accept-Encoding header can cause Apache Traffic Server to fail cache lookup and force forwarding requests.
This issue affects Apache Traffic Server: from 8.0.0 through 8.1.10, from 9.0.0 through 9.2.4.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 8.1.11 or 9.2.5, which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-35161|2024-08-02T03:07:46.737Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description:
Apache Traffic Server forwards malformed HTTP chunked trailer section to origin servers. This can be utilized for request smuggling and may also lead cache poisoning if the origin servers are vulnerable.
This issue affects Apache Traffic Server: from 8.0.0 through 8.1.10, from 9.0.0 through 9.2.4.
Users can set a new setting (proxy.config.http.drop_chunked_trailers) not to forward chunked trailer section. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 8.1.11 or 9.2.5, which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-35161|2024-07-31T17:47:08.763Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description:
Apache Traffic Server forwards malformed HTTP chunked trailer section to origin servers. This can be utilized for request smuggling and may also lead cache poisoning if the origin servers are vulnerable.
This issue affects Apache Traffic Server: from 8.0.0 through 8.1.10, from 9.0.0 through 9.2.4.
Users can set a new setting (proxy.config.http.drop_chunked_trailers) not to forward chunked trailer section. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 8.1.11 or 9.2.5, which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2023-38522|2024-07-26T13:37:33.033Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description:
Apache Traffic Server accepts characters that are not allowed for HTTP field names and forwards malformed requests to origin servers. This can be utilized for request smuggling and may also lead cache poisoning if the origin servers are vulnerable.
This issue affects Apache Traffic Server: from 8.0.0 through 8.1.10, from 9.0.0 through 9.2.4.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 8.1.11 or 9.2.5, which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-31309|2024-06-04T17:36:32.885Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description:
HTTP/2 CONTINUATION DoS attack can cause Apache Traffic Server to consume more resources on the server. Version from 8.0.0 through 8.1.9, from 9.0.0 through 9.2.3 are affected.
Users can set a new setting (proxy.config.http2.max_continuation_frames_per_minute) to limit the number of CONTINUATION frames per minute. ATS does have a fixed amount of memory a request can use and ATS adheres to these limits in previous releases. Users are recommended to upgrade to versions 8.1.10 or 9.2.4 which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-35161|2024-07-26T09:10:56.281Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description:
Apache Traffic Server forwards malformed HTTP chunked trailer section to origin servers. This can be utilized for request smuggling and may also lead cache poisoning if the origin servers are vulnerable.
This issue affects Apache Traffic Server: from 8.0.0 through 8.1.10, from 9.0.0 through 9.2.4.
Users can set a new setting (proxy.config.http.drop_chunked_trailers) not to forward chunked trailer section. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 8.1.11 or 9.2.5, which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-31309|2024-08-02T01:52:56.330Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20traffic%20server
item.description:
HTTP/2 CONTINUATION DoS attack can cause Apache Traffic Server to consume more resources on the server. Version from 8.0.0 through 8.1.9, from 9.0.0 through 9.2.3 are affected.
Users can set a new setting (proxy.config.http2.max_continuation_frames_per_minute) to limit the number of CONTINUATION frames per minute. ATS does have a fixed amount of memory a request can use and ATS adheres to these limits in previous releases. Users are recommended to upgrade to versions 8.1.10 or 9.2.4 which fixes the issue.
